intro: Erigeron frondeus, commonly known as the fronded fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically white or pale blue. Erigeron frondeus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
